text:
Yury Ivanovich Belyayev (; 2 April 1934 – 14 December 2019) was a Soviet football player and coach. He played in 111 matches for CSKA Moscow, scoring 52 goals. He was a member of the national team that won a gold medal at the 1956 Summer Olympics.
From 1974 to 1980, he coached in the Soviet Armed Forces.
In 1991, Belyayev was honored as a Merited Master of Sport by the Soviet Union.
On 14 December 2019, Belyayev died at the age of 85.
